body_html:
import numpy as np
import tensorflow
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

plt.plot(np.arange(100))
plt.show()

Produces a segmentation fault, too.

Surprisingly:

import numpy as np                                                                                                                                                                                
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt 
import tensorflow

plt.plot(np.arange(100))
plt.show()

runs fine, no issues at all.

What kind of dark magic is this?^^
Does TensorFlow actually need dependencies to be imported before TensorFlow is imported itself?
Why isn't this happening in TensorFlow 0.7.1?

import numpy as np
import tensorflow
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

plt.plot(np.arange(100))
plt.show()

Produces a segmentation fault, too.
Surprisingly:
import numpy as np                                                                                                                                                                                
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt 
import tensorflow

plt.plot(np.arange(100))
plt.show()

runs fine, no issues at all.
What kind of dark magic is this?^^
Does TensorFlow actually need dependencies to be imported before TensorFlow is imported itself?
Why isn't this happening in TensorFlow 0.7.1?
body:
```
import numpy as np
import tensorflow
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

plt.plot(np.arange(100))
plt.show()
```

Produces a segmentation fault, too.

Surprisingly:

```
import numpy as np                                                                                                                                                                                
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt 
import tensorflow

plt.plot(np.arange(100))
plt.show()
```

runs fine, no issues at all.

What kind of dark magic is this?^^
Does TensorFlow actually _need_ dependencies to be imported _before_ TensorFlow is imported itself?
Why isn't this happening in TensorFlow 0.7.1?
